figure_1:
H&N=head and neck.
*The mental component summary (MCS) score is one of 2 sub-scores of the short form 12 (SF-12). Scores are standardized with a t-score transformation with a mean of 50 (SD: 10) with a maximum score of 100. Higher scores indicate better quality oflife with scores greater than 50 representing above average health status.
figure_2:
H&N=head and neck
*The satisfaction with appearance scale (SWAP) contains 14 items rated on a 7-point scale with 1 indicating strongly disagree and 7 indicating strongly agree. Total scores range from 0 to 84 with higher scores indicating greater dissatisfaction with appearance and body image following injury.
